All about the Geena Davis Institute and the history of gender bias and parity efforts ( mostly failures) in Hollywood. So good! I learned alot, and it could present some good clips for any future custom training you might build for NBCU."
Most recent update from Joy. Thought I'd share it here too :).

Nicole Barile and Vince Bongiovanni Today, I've worked on the NBCU report; taking into consideration all of the input we've received to date with a focus on the evolving story of the recommendations. On one hand the edits (to content) remain relatively the same; however, on the others the changes are significant, but mostly structural. I'm proposing some significant re organization. This is because while our recommendations remain basically the same, I wanted to create a more clear and singular narrative. This process also helped me identify the redundancies that have been mentioned and hopefully eliminate them while making the relationship between recommendations more evident.
Hey all! I put the new NBCU deck in Files, under Recommendations. It's titled "UFEG Revisions....."

Maxel Schingen Vince Bongiovanni Tamara Thorpe I just uploaded the PPT under the Recommendations folder. Max & Vince - you can look at slides 16-27 to see where you can enter your quotes. Ignore the rest of the deck - it's a mess! . Thanks all!!

6/9 Meeting: To discuss themes and get into discussing recommendations. Also chat about upcoming 6/10 meeting to debrief interviews. - For Thurs call we need to provide examples, ask questions, and show detailed themes. They also want to get an idea what the recommendations will look like/be like - Per our 6/8 meeting with NBCU, Vince will be working on a grid-like chart that shows who gets what in terms of recommendations & reporting out (project team, Abhijay & Dwight, studio heads, focus group participants, survey participants) - to be sent to NBCU prior to Thurs call - We need to submit some questions ahead of time prior to Thurs call - Is Abhijay above studio heads? - Tell us more about how decisions are made - Who initiates change typically? What is the process for change within the org? - Tell us more about matching grants - Donna Langley interview now 6/23 - must incorporate into analysis - Notes: - What else do we need to know that we don't know yet? More about their decision-making processes? How are decisions made? - What else are they doing in terms of DEI initiatives? Can we tie that into our recs? Joy & Mel getting some info to us - How can we include studio heads throughout - can we talk about this on Thurs? They want studio heads to feel they are included early - Date for presenting analysis & recs maybe June 29 during our weekly call - just for project team - Joy & Mel will share sample of data so we can see how they present to studio heads; however, they said to use our LCW format/style _____________________________________________________________________________

New SOW, UTBE - not customized: " switch out the Netflix video for an alternate video on representation. We can also make any other adjustment that you all think will make it the best fit for you all."

A weekly internal meeting to discuss NBCU work
NBCU wants to sort data by studio. In order to do this in Survey Monkey, we will need separate links for each studio - Universal, Focus, DreamWorks. Not sure about GTDI??
PVOD = Premium Videos On Demand

Things Monica & Chuck should know about 1:1 interviews: Margie - be pragmatics, direct, business-driven, Monica should drive and make Margie feel comfortable, Margie more comfortable talking in small groups settings, she cares and gets it but competency isn't there, recent departures of Black employees from DW. Kujo - more laid-back and conversational, don't be super corporate, be direct. Peter - concerned about making mistakes and what his boss (Donna L) thinks of him, he will need to be clear on how the info is being used, nervous calling people out on their behavior, make it intimate , wants to look favorable, must be genuine, make him feel psychologically safe

For 1:1 interviews - initial thoughts from Joy: - Margie Cohn: Monica + Maybe Tamara? - Peter Cramer: Monica + Randy/Chuck or Larry, not sure yet. I would lobby for Randy and Monica (want female perspective for sure), but the team feels like we need a BIPOC presence to the feedback can be fully internalized. - Pete Kujawski: Not sure. Want to get some more context from Michelle. Lean toward Monica + Chuck

channel: LCW Buddy Program for Cross-Cultural Learning / Week 3
message: Lesson 3 is also now posted in the "Files" tab. Special notes: Critical Background for the LCW Team: The 4 mini-videos leveraged in this lesson are brand new, and have just recently been added to the LCW solutions deck. For almost everyone at LCW, this lesson is their first opportunity to view these videos. T he idea for them came in the early days of COVID-19 and before the murder of George Floyd, when LCW was faced with a dramatic drop in contracts and revenue. As organizations responded to the epidemic by scaling back their training and spending, LCW looked inward at that moment to seize the new found ‘down time’ to innovate new product ideas, among them the “mini-video rapid design” concept of: (a) building bite-sized videos quickly and relatively cheaply by putting to work the operation team’s skillsets for video production alongside the consulting team’s content knowledge, (b) developing the content in a collaborative process where several LCW consultants would work together on script-writing and iterations to bring the videos to life in the best way for our clients. Shortly after this plan was hatched, the murder of George Floyd led to such a dramatic spike in everyone’s workload that no one had time to fully execute on the multi-person, collaborative nature of these initial plans. Instead, a new ‘proof of concept’ plan emerged; these 4 mini-videos would be produced as a side project in whatever moments a couple of LCW staff members could carve out. Now that LCW’s staff has grown and the team once again has sufficient bandwidth to innovate, a parallel goal of Lesson 3 is to provide a fresh look at the opportunity these 4 proof of concept mini-videos present. What can/should/will LCW do next? How can LCW build on this proof of concept with new products? What products in this category would most ‘wow’ LCW clients and deliver on LCW’s value proposition? NOTE: This lesson is also designed with the shorter 4-day work week in mind, and should take you half as much time to complete as previous lessons.
